The Kitakami Museum of Art in Tokyo has been awarded the 2020 Kitakami Museum Prize. The $30,000 award comes with a $50,000 prize for excellence in art. The additional award for excellence in photography will be given in recognition of the staff’s work in documenting the museum’s collection of over four hundred works.The Kitakami Museum is a four-story museum, dedicated to the collection of modern and contemporary art, which opened in 1988. A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the museum has a collection of more than 4,500 works dating from 1960 to the present. The museum has been awarded the Nobel Prize in Art in History of Arts last year.The 2018 Kitakami Museum Prize was presented by Kunihiko Miyazawa, the director of the Takao Museum in Tokyo, and was first presented by the collection in 2017. In 2013, the catalogue of the Italian museum Giardia di Savoia was stolen by two men who broke into the institution and took it apart, leaving only a pile of artworks. The theft was captured on film by a security guard at the entrance of the museum, and the exhibition was on view for a week, sparking a political outcry. The perpetrator was convicted and served a few weeks in prison, but was subsequently released after serving only three months.
